p: Myrtaceae is one of the most important families of the Brazilian flora, and it has representatives of significant medicinal interest [ 1]. This family is composed of approximately 150 genera and 4630 species, especially distributed in the tropical and subtropical regions. It is widely dispersed in the Americas and in Australia, although it is found all over the world [ 2]. In Brazil, there are 23 genera and approximately 1034 species present throughout the country [ 3].
